pageContext.claim: “You know, like, at the court in Canada, we always lose. Well, the judges are three Canadians and two Americans. We always lose. ”
pageContext.analysis: Trump likely is referring to the binational dispute resolution panels for anti-dumping and countervailing duties, under NAFTA. These five-member panels comprise two members from each country, and a fifth member that both sides agree to. In a case involving Canada and the United States, the panel may consist of three Canadians and two Americans, or three Americans and two Canadians. Experts say most decisions by the five-member panels are done unanimously, meaning the panelists set aside their nationality to decide the cases.
